entity.name: Vipul Sharma
entity.description: Independent analog/mixed-signal IC designer working on open-source RF building blocks, tools, and education. Focused on enabling students, researchers, and startups to design real silicon using open PDKs and free EDA tooling.

projects.name: Open-Source Phase-Programmable LNA for NAVIC L5
projects.description: An open-source low-noise amplifier with programmable RF phase control, designed using the IHP SG13G2 open PDK. Intended for NAVIC L5 GNSS beamforming (anti-jamming/anti-spoofing CRPA systems). The project demonstrates how open EDA tools and open PDKs can enable high-performance RF IC design for education, research, and startups — without restrictive licenses.

channels.description: Primary channel for grants and larger transfers.

plans.name: Documentation, tutorials, and student onboarding
plans.description: Complete beginner-friendly docs, examples, and training material showing how to design RF chips using open PDKs and tools — using this LNA as a reference design.

plans.name: Design completion, simulations, and verification
plans.description: Finalize LNA architecture, phase-shifter integration, EM/layout verification, test benches, and reproducible open flows.

plans.name: Community support & maintenance
plans.description: Ongoing bug fixes, updates, mentoring, and responding to issues so the project remains usable for others.

history.description: Initial development conducted voluntarily without external funding.
